author: Hadlee Simons
title: Facebook testing 'Reactions'
text:
Facebook testing 'Reactions' Fri, 09 Oct 2015 3:44 PM Share Your Email 
Facebook has revealed that it's testing a new "Reactions" feature, giving users an extension to the "like" button. 
The social network is currently testing the feature in Ireland and Spain, allowing these users to "react" to any post. 
The feature will also be used to gauge interest in posts, Facebook said in a blog post . 
"Initially, just as we do when someone likes a post, if someone uses a Reaction, we will infer they want to see more of that type of post. We will spend time learning from this initial rollout and iterate based on findings in the future," the social network explained. 

Today we're launching a test of Reactions -- a more expressive Like button. The Like button has been a part of... 

So what kind of reactions can we expect? 
A video posted by Mark Zuckerberg revealed a variety of emoticons, such as a heart, an angry emoji and more. 
"Reactions gives you new ways to express love, awe, humour and sadness. It's not a dislike button, but it does give you the power to easily express sorrow and empathy - in addition to delight and warmth. You'll be able to express these reactions by long pressing or hovering over the Like button," Zuckerberg added. Read More
